1LW.F.summary: Polwax S.A. produces and distributes refined and deodorized paraffin, waxes, and specialty industrial paraffin compositions. The company also offers anti-corrosion agents, anti-caking agents, casting waxes, hot-melt adhesives, and other industrial products, as well as candles and grave lights. Its products are used in fertilizer, rubber, food, and paper and packaging industries; the production of varnishes, paints, and construction materials; and the manufacture of wood impregnations, explosives, candles, and grave lights, as well as in investment casting and wood processing activities, and other special applications. Polwax S.A. was founded in 2012 and is based in Jaslo, Poland.

ARP.ST.summary: Arctic Paper S.A., together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells paper for printing houses, paper distributors, book and magazine publishing houses, and the advertising industries in Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Scandinavia, Poland, other Western Europe, Central and Eastern Europe, and internationally. The company operates through Uncoated Paper, Coated Papers, Pulp, and Other segments. It offers uncoated wood-free papers, such as white offset, woodfree bulky book, and graphic papers; coated wood-free papers; uncoated wood-containing papers, such as wood containing bulky book papers; fully bleached and unbleached sulphate pulps; and chemi-thermo mechanical and groundwood pulps. The company markets its uncoated paper products under the Amber and Munken brands; and coated paper products under the G-Print and Arctic brands. In addition, it generates, transmits, and distributes electricity; produces and distributes heat; distributes paper; rents properties, and machines and equipment; and produces hydro power and food packaging products, as well as provides trading, logistics, and procurement bureau services. The company was founded in 1983 and is based in Kostrzyn, Poland. Arctic Paper S.A. is a subsidiary of Nemus Holding AB.

CHX.F.summary: Ciech S.A. manufactures and sells various chemical products in Poland, other European Union countries, other European countries, Africa, Asia, and internationally. It operates through four segments: Soda, Organic, Silicates and Glass, and Transport. The company provides various soda-based products, including sodium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, evaporated salt, sorbeco, and calcium chloride; crop protection products, resins, and polyurethane foams; and glass products and silicates, as well as glass packaging and plastic products. It also offers various rail transport services, such as rental of rail carriages, rail cargo transport services, and maintenance of rail sidings. In addition, the company is involved in the distribution of soda ash, baking soda, vacuum salt, and calcium chloride; and solid and liquid, organic and inorganic chemicals, acids, and bases, as well as solvents. Further, it offers raw materials for household, cosmetic, and pharmaceutical products; milk and sugar industries; feed industry and selected branches of the heavy industry, including galvanizing plants, smelters, coke plants, and foundries; and water treatment and sewage treatment plants, as well as manufacturers of tires, paints, and varnishes. Additionally, the company engages in the research and development, real property sale and management, and financing activities. The company was founded in 1945 and is based in Warsaw, Poland. Ciech S.A. is a subsidiary of KI Chemistry S. Ã  r. l.

GQ2.F.summary: Grupa Kety S.A., through its subsidiaries, manufactures and sells aluminum products in Poland and internationally. It operates through three segments: Extruded Products, Aluminum Systems, and Flexible Packaging. The company produces aluminum profiles and components. It also designs and produces architectural systems and external aluminum roller shutters; engages in the production, trade, and servicing of window and door systems, faÃ§ade systems, roller shutter profiles and boxes, roller-shutters, and gates and accessories for PVC, wood, and aluminum joinery. In addition, the company provides construction and assembly services, as well as flexible packaging solutions. Grupa Kety S.A. sells its products under the Grupa Kety, Aluprof, and Alupol Packaging brands. The company was formerly known as Zaklady Metali Lekkich ÂKETYÂ and changed its name to Grupa Kety S.A. in 2000. Grupa Kety S.A. was founded in 1953 and is headquartered in Kety, Poland.

J2S.F.summary: Jastrzebska SpÃ³lka Weglowa S.A. engages in the extraction, production, and sale of coal, coke, and hydrocarbons. It consists of five coal mines, including Borynia-ZofiÃ³wka, Budryk, Jastrzebie-Bzie, KnurÃ³w-Szczyglowice, and PniÃ³wek. The company provides inspection and repair services for internal transport equipment; and technical research services, chemical and physiochemical analyses of minerals, solid liquid, and gaseous materials and products. It is also involved in the provision of railway lines; maintenance of railway infrastructure and equipment; construction and repairs of railway systems and facilities; building security and auxiliary services; and water and sewage-related services, discharge of salt water, supply of industrial water, reclamation activity and production of salt. In addition, the company provides computer hardware consulting and data processing services; insurance intermediation and administration services; tourist and hotel services; rail siding; transportation and general construction services; mechanic, electric repair, renovation, and maintenance of automation technology; and post-mining waste disposal and reclamation services. Further, it manufactures spare parts, assemblies, devices, steel structures, technical equipment, tools, and instruments; renovates, maintains, and upkeeps machinery and equipment; produces machinery for mining, quarrying, and construction; and provides mining, architectural and engineering, machinery leasing services, as well as engages in the designing and execution of vertical and horizontal mine workings and tunnels. The company serves energy companies, and heat and power plants in Poland, Germany, Austria, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Switzerland, Spain, Romania, France, Belgium, Norway, Luxembourg, Sweden, and other countries. Jastrzebska SpÃ³lka Weglowa S.A. was founded in 1993 and is based in Jastrzebie-ZdrÃ³j, Poland.

KGH.PR.summary: KGHM Polska Miedz S.A. mines, produces, and sells copper, precious metals, and non-ferrous metals in Poland and internationally. The company offers copper cathodes, wire rods, Cu-OFE and Cu-Ag wires, and granule products; silver in bullion bar and granule forms; gold bars; molybdenum; metallic rhenium, ammonium perrhenate, and rhenium powder; and lead, sulphuric acid, copper and nickel sulphate, and selenium products, as well as platinum, palladium, and rock salt. It also generates, transmits, and distributes electrical and heating energy; trades in oil-based product, consumer goods, and chemicals; constructs mine, and roadway/railway tunnels; transports roadway and railway cargo; and measures imissions and emissions. In addition, the company produces mining and construction machinery and equipment, explosives, Nitrocet 50, initiating systems, electrical and hydraulic cables, automated equipment, communication systems, graphene, and building materials. Further, it engages in the industrial research, drilling and blasting work, medical practice, and consulting and technical activity; certifies and attests machinery and equipment; trades in and processes non-ferrous metals scrap and shaft slag; recovers rhenium, copper, and silver metals; recycles waste; and sells steel and aluminum. Additionally, it provides specialist construction and drilling, steel construction, machinery repair and maintenance, logistics, passenger roadway transport, rolling, gastronomic, electrical engineering, commercial, catering, hotel, recreation, rehabilitation, health tourism, wellness, spa-healing, sanatorium, preventative and occupational medicine, rehabilitation, biological renewal, hospital, water sewage management, design, real estate market, construction, financing, and insurance services; manages railway infrastructure; manages investment funds; manages a football club; and organizes professional sporting events. The company was founded in 1961 and is headquartered in Lubin, Poland.
